metadata.description: AI Infrastructure Unwinding Monitor - Q3 2025 Update with AI Infrastructure Specialists

risk_rationale.summary: Composite Risk Score of 7/40 indicates LOW RISK. AI infrastructure buildout continues to accelerate with no Phase 1 unwinding signals in operational metrics. All major hyperscalers raised capex guidance in Q3 2025. The 2 Active Signals tracked include both positive developments (capex acceleration) and emerging concerns (Meta investor skepticism).
risk_rationale.why_low: Score of 7 is well below the 9-point threshold for MODERATE risk. Capex guidance universally increasing (not decreasing), no excess GPU capacity, no project delays, strong semiconductor demand. Collective hyperscaler spending exceeds $380B for 2025. Each RED indicator (capex cuts >15%, AI growth <20% YoY, utilization <60%) would add 2-6 points to the score - none are currently triggered.
risk_rationale.why_not_moderate: Would need 9+ points to reach MODERATE. No capex reductions detected (would add 3-6 points). AI revenue growth remains strong 25-55% YoY range - no RED signals (would add 6 points if <20%). No indicators of excess capacity or utilization concerns (would add 4 points). Operating fundamentals remain healthy across all primary indicators.
risk_rationale.concerns: Current 7 points come from: (1) AI revenue deceleration from hypergrowth = 1 point × 3x multiplier = 3 points, (2) Meta market reaction signaling sentiment risk = 1 point × 2x multiplier = 2 points, (3) Minor margin/valuation concerns = 2 points × 1x = 2 points. Meta stock drop (-11% despite beat) signals emerging investor skepticism. CoreWeave revenue guidance miss suggests potential demand softening in specialist tier. These are sentiment risks, not operational signals yet.
risk_rationale.key_watch: NVIDIA Q3 earnings (Nov 19) critical - if Data Center revenue misses or guidance disappoints, could add 4-6 points, pushing toward MODERATE (9-16 range). Meta sentiment spreading to MSFT/AMZN/GOOGL could add another 2-4 points. Any hyperscaler announcing capex reduction >5% would immediately add 3 points (YELLOW) or 6 points if >15% (RED). Active Signals of 2 reflects these two key developments being monitored.

indicator_scoring.formula: Composite Risk Score = Σ (Indicator Points × Multiplier)

indicators.name: Capex Guidance
indicators.description: All hyperscalers raised capex guidance in Q3 2025

indicators.name: AI Revenue Growth
indicators.description: Decelerating from hypergrowth but still 25-55% YoY

indicators.name: GPU Utilization
indicators.description: No indicators of excess capacity, demand remains strong

indicators.name: Margin Compression
indicators.description: Meta investor concerns, sentiment pressure emerging

indicators.name: Timeline Changes
indicators.description: No project delays announced, buildouts on schedule

indicators.name: Enterprise Adoption
indicators.description: Mixed signals, proving ROI in various use cases

indicators.name: Cost Economics
indicators.description: Improving but not yet viable for all use cases

indicators.name: Semiconductor Orders
indicators.description: Strong demand, NVIDIA backlog robust (pending Q3 confirmation)

active_signals.title: Hyperscaler CapEx Acceleration Continues
active_signals.description: All major hyperscalers increased 2025 capex guidance in Q3 earnings. Collective spending now exceeds $380B for 2025, up from ~$315B projections.

active_signals.title: Meta Market Reaction: AI Spending Skepticism
active_signals.description: Meta stock dropped 11% despite beating estimates - largest drop in 3 years. Investor concerns about AI spending ROI despite $70-72B capex guidance increase.

companies.name: Microsoft (MSFT)
companies.notes: AI business fastest ever to $10B milestone. CFO Hood confirmed FY2026 capex acceleration.

companies.name: Amazon (AMZN)
companies.notes: CFO Olsavsky indicated capex will grow further in 2026. Q1 2025: $24.3B.

companies.name: Alphabet (GOOGL)
companies.ai_growth: Cloud AI strong, 1/4 of code now AI-generated
companies.notes: Raised capex guidance. 60% servers, 40% data center/networking. Q1: $17B.

companies.name: Meta (META)
companies.capex: $70-72B (2025 guidance raised from $66-72B) - Q3: $19.37B (+14% QoQ, +111% YoY)
companies.notes: Stock dropped 11% (worst in 3 years) despite beat - investor concerns about AI ROI. Lacks cloud revenue story unlike peers.

companies.name: NVIDIA (NVDA)
companies.notes: Q3 earnings pending Nov 19. Consensus: $1.23 EPS on $54.59B revenue. Data Center demand remains strong.

companies.name: Oracle (ORCL)
companies.notes: Q2 FY2026: Cloud infra $3.3B (+52% YoY), RPO $97.3B (+50%). $30B OpenAI deal (4.5GW capacity). Raised $18B bonds, negotiating $38B more. Stargate project financing concerns emerging.

companies.name: CoreWeave (CRWV)
companies.notes: IPO March 2025 @$40, now $105. Q3: $1.36B revenue, $55.6B backlog. $6.5B OpenAI expansion, $14.2B Meta deal. Revenue guidance cut to $5.05-5.15B (vs $5.29B expected).

companies.name: Iris Energy (IREN)
companies.notes: Bitcoin miner pivoting to AI cloud. Stock +269% YTD 2025. Doubling GPU fleet to 23k GPUs. Market cap: $17.09B.

companies.name: Applied Digital (APLD)
companies.notes: $11B CoreWeave contract (400MW), $5B hyperscaler deal (200MW). Q1 FY2026: $64.2M revenue. Stock +39.4% YTD 2025.

companies.name: Nebius (NBIS)
companies.notes: Formerly Yandex, renamed Aug 2024. Q3: $146.1M revenue. $19.4B Microsoft deal, $3B Meta deal (Nov 2025). Stock +475% past year.

capex_guidance.notes: Q3 2025: All hyperscalers raised guidance. Collective >$380B for 2025, up from $315B projections. Microsoft accelerating in FY2026.

ai_revenue_growth.notes: Microsoft AI: $10B+ run rate. Mag 7: +26.7% earnings, +17.6% revenue. NVIDIA expected +55.6%. Still strong but decelerating from hypergrowth.

gpu_utilization.notes: Q3 2025: No indicators of excess capacity. NVIDIA demand commentary remains positive ahead of Nov 19 earnings.

margin_compression.notes: Meta facing investor skepticism despite spending increases. Market reaction suggests ROI concerns emerging.

timeline_changes.notes: No major project delays in Q3 reports. Buildouts proceeding as planned.

semiconductor_orders.notes: NVIDIA Q3 earnings Nov 19 will be key indicator. Current consensus: $54.59B revenue (+55.6% YoY).

credit_spreads.notes: No signs of credit stress. Tech investment-grade spreads remain compressed.

private_valuations.notes: No new funding rounds reported in Q3. Meta market reaction signals investor patience may be tested.

quarterly_updates.summary: Hyperscaler capex acceleration continues with all major players raising 2025 guidance. Collective spending now >$380B. However, Meta's market reaction signals emerging investor skepticism about AI ROI despite continued spending. Risk remains LOW but watching for sentiment shifts.
highlights: Meta raised guidance to $70-72B but stock dropped 11% - worst decline in 3 years
Amazon guiding $125B for 2025, CFO indicated further growth in 2026
Microsoft confirming FY2026 capex acceleration, AI business hitting $10B+ run rate
NVIDIA earnings Nov 19 will be critical - consensus $54.59B revenue (+55.6% YoY)
Key concern: Meta reaction shows market testing patience on AI monetization timeline

quarterly_updates.summary: All major hyperscalers reported strong AI revenue growth. No capex reductions announced. Risk remains low.
highlights: NVIDIA Data Center revenue exceeded expectations

usage_instructions.note: This is a template file. Update with actual data from earnings calls, SEC filings, and news monitoring.
usage_instructions.update_frequency: Update companies[] and indicator_tracking{} quarterly after earnings. Update news_sentiment{} weekly.
usage_instructions.risk_scoring: Composite risk score: 0-8 = LOW, 9-16 = MODERATE, 17-24 = HIGH, 25+ = CRITICAL
